content: द्वैधीभावः {@--1@} Duality, double state or nature. {@--2@} Separation into two, difference, diversity. {@--3@} Doubt, uncertainty, vacillation, suspense; धृतद्वैधीभावकातरं मे मनः <ls>Ś. 1.</ls> {@--4@} A dilemma. {@--5@} One of the six Guṇas or modes of foreign policy. (According to some authorities it means ‘double-dealing’ or ‘duplicity’, ‘keeping apparently friendly relations with the enemy’; बलिनोर्द्विषतोर्मध्ये वाचात्मानं समर्पयन् . द्वैधीभावेन तिष्ठेत्तु काकाक्षिवदलक्षितः ... According to others it means ‘dividing one's army and encountering a superior enemy in detachments’, ‘harassing the enemy by attacking them in small bands’; द्वैधीभावः स्वबलस्य द्विधाकरणं <ls>Mit.</ls> on <ls>Y. 1. 347</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> also <ls>Ms. 7. 173</ls> and <ls n="Ms. 7.">160</ls>). {@--6@} A contest, dispute. {@--7@} Falsehood, duplicity.
